result.execSummary:
The defendant Cytisa Carlet Dixon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 10 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $453 costs, consecutive to jail sentence and 15CM2200.
Concurrent with any sentence now serving.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Cytisa Carlet Dixon in court in custody with attorney Valerie A. Zisman.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No contest plea, Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders 5 months 20 days Rock Co Jail, concurrent with any sentence now serving; 10 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $453 costs, consecutive to this sentence and 15CM2200; no sentence credit.

Defendant Cytisa Carlet Dixon in court in custody with attorney Valerie A. Zisman.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Cytisa Carlet Dixon in court in custody with attorney Valerie A. Zisman.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Cytisa Carlet Dixon in court in custody with attorney Ashley Jade Morse.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 10, 2015, at 9:00 am.
No contact directly or indirectly with Rock County Walmarts.
